arm_group.description: Females undergoing therapeutic procedures that will potentially lead to the irreversible loss of ovarian function will have their ovarian tissue retrieved and cryopreserved. Ideally, after treatment, the cryopreserved ovarian tissue can be thawed and auto-transplanted and ovarian function resumed.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to retrieve and cryopreserve ovarian tissue from females
      undergoing a treatment that may lead to irreversible loss of ovarian function.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ovarian Tissue Cryopreservation in Females Undergoing Procedures That Will Potentially Lead To Loss of Ovarian Function
condition: Unspecified Complication of Bone Marrow Transplant

detailed_description.textblock:
The aim of this preliminary study is to retrieve and properly cryopreserve ovarian tissue
      for autotransplantation in any premenopausal female whose ovarian function is threatened in
      a physiological, pathological or iatrogenic manner in an effort to observe the return of
      ovarian endocrine function and development of egg(s) appropriate for use in in vitro
      fertilization.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patient must be female.

          -  Patient must have a disease process where the disease or its treatment      adversely
             affects ovarian function.

          -  Patient must be recommended for this study by their oncologist or specialist.

          -  Patient (or legally authorized representative) must sign an informed consent.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients cannot be male.

          -  Patients must not be HIV positive.

          -  Patient cannot have a poor diagnosis such that she is not expected to survive to
             adulthood.

          -  Patient cannot have any medical condition that would contraindicate surgery.

          -  Patient cannot have any medical condition that would contraindicate general
             anesthesia.

          -  Patient cannot have any medical condition that would contraindicate pregnancy.

intervention.description: Females undergoing therapeutic procedures that will potentially lead to the irreversible loss of ovarian function will have their ovarian tissue retrieved and cryopreserved. Ideally, after treatment, the cryopreserved ovarian tissue can be thawed and auto-transplanted and ovarian function resumed.

facility.name: Froedtert and The Medical College of Wisconsin

clinical_study.official_title: Ovarian Tissue Cryopreservation As A Means Of Preserving Ovarian Function in Females Undergoing Therapeutic Procedures That Will Potentially Lead To The Irreversible Loss of Ovarian Function

primary_outcome.measure: Return of hormones produced by the ovarian tissue

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor, Director of Division of Reproductive Endocrinology and Infertility

secondary_outcome.measure: Development of egg(s) appropriate for use in in vitro fertilization
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed through their reproductive years (until the patient reaches 45 years of age)

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
